Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night the night before our cruise. It was great! The best part was the free breakfast downstairs in the morning. I will definitely go there again. I paid $60 for the room on priceline. I will definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, but...”
Reviews.Author: Nicilovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Was good value for money, cheaper than all the other suite hotels in the area. I liked the king bed suite, enough space for two parents, one toddler and one baby. Not completely new but ok. They didnt clean the first day, ok, I was only two hours away, maybe they missed this time gap. But the didnt clean the second day either, where we were away for 6 hours. My husband talked to the cleaning ladies and they said, well, there was so many stuff laying on the floor. Hello? Of course, my little son leaves his toys on the floor. And we have two strollers. And a lot of stuff traveling with two little ones. Is this a reason for not cleaning the room? At least they could have changed the towels. Then my husband complained at the reception and they were very sorry and offered a free dinner for the whole family or extra goldpoints. We took the goldpoints and figured it a good compensation. The breakfast was good for the price of the hotel, really good orange juice, waffles, scrambled eggs and so on. The airconditioning is very good which I liked espacially, since fresh air is very important to me and you cant open the windows in this hotel. At the right price I would return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great price”
Reviews.Author: Sweet412
Reviews.Content: I had to go to a job fair and a convention in San Deigo so I booked this hotel last minute and what a nice surprise 1. Handicap Accessable Room- I have requested that through Expedia for my mom who needs a wheelin shower rather than the usualy bathtub, when I checked in they gladly checked me in the room I needed eventhough Expedia didnt notify them. 2. Room- was very nice and clean , the tv is quite old and not many channels but the room and bed was very comfortable 3. breakfast- the breakfast was amazing: Potatoes, bacon, scrambled eggs, yogurt, 4 different kind of cereal, toast, bagels, muffins, and a place where u can make your own waffles, also fruit and juices. You can never go wrong with the breakfast they have, simply amazing, and you can also read the complimentary newspaper or sit in an area with a flat screen tv and watch while you are eating 4. Parking - there was plenty of parking and also there was handicap parking for people who needed it for wheelchairs, Ryan at the reception was so nice and accomodating he even called the first night to check if everything is ok 5. Distance - it is a good 15 minutes dricing to downtown, but very nice area and one exit from La Jolla village, I definetely recommend it to anyone in town, if I am ever back in town I will come back again :)

Reviews.Title: “This place used to be good”
Reviews.Author: Traveler075
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times and it has gone downhill. The rooms are getting shabby and half the equipment in the exercise room is broken.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: travelerAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an extended period and got a fantastic rate on priceline. Free parking, free wifi, free full breakfast 7 days a week were all bonuses. Located close to highways and rooms were adequate. Would definitely stay here again. My husband loved the belgian waffles at breakfast but there were also eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt, cereal, bagels, danishes, etc. The overall value was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “good San Diego deal”
Reviews.Author: socalsweethearts
Reviews.Content: Pros: great price via priceline; very good breakfast; free parking; free internet access; large king room; nice fitness equipment; helpful staff; quiet location; good work/desk chair; USA Today and Wall Street journal Cons: spotty wireless internet, no wired internet; limited TV channel selection; older (though large) TVs For a business traveler, the inconsistent wifi in the rooms could be a pain. Otherwise this was a nice hotel at a fantastic price via priceline. Many S.D. hotels charge for parking, internet, breakfast, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. . .in 1980”
Reviews.Author: Mytinitravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn in Mira Mesa after being satisfied with our stays at a few other CI's in other parts of the US. Unfortunately, the major renovation of this hotel obviously did not include the rooms. We reserved a suite from the hotel site and like others, got a great rate with their discounts for staying multiple nights. Our first room was in such disrepair with a broken couch and missing countertop area that we lugged all our bags back downstairs to request another room. The second room was plagued by worn furniture and a stained bathroom, but it was passable. We figured this was the best we could get. We should have tried a third, because the second night the sprinkler leaked onto our suitcases. Luckily there is a washer/dryer in the building otherwise it would have been a day at the laundrymat. If you can look past the tired rooms, then I agree with the other reviewers that the free breakfast was above expectation and free parking is a nice touch. We thought the location was excellent as we visited both downtown and northern San Diego county. The hotel staff we encountered tried very hard to make a pleasant stay for us. They don't have much to work with in this hotel. I'd keep looking for another property for our next San Diego vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: secretagentangie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location (right off the 805) and was close to all of the people that I wanted to visit and see. The room was better than I had expected, and I am thoroughly pleased with my experience there. I'm certain that if I had been from out of town (meaning not from Southern California), I would have loved the convenience and location! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY CUPS...Pictures included”
Reviews.Author: ErythAngel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 19 - 21 Sept. Friday night, I washed the coffee cups they provided for us in the bathroom sink. Saturday morning, I marked the bottoms of the cups with eyeliner and left traces of coffee in them. It was obvious these cups were dirty. There are cards that you are supposed to place on your beds to indicate whether or not you want them to be made. You are also encouraged to put your towels on the floor if they need replaced. We made sure the cards were on the beds and the towels were on the racks. When we returned Saturday night, there were clean towels and semi-made beds (the sheets and blankets were haphazardly thrown over the mattress). The coffee cups had covers on them, giving the appearance that they were clean. When I turned them over, the markings were still there. This leads me to believe that they had rinsed our cups out in the sink and used our dirty towels (or worse, somebody else's towels) to dry them. That kind of freaks me out. I shouldn't have to wonder if they were properly cleaned before our arrival. And I can't help but think about what else they are cutting corners on. Other than that... The hotel was in a good neighborhood. It was only a few minutes away from Sea World and Legoland. The staff was nice. The continental breakfast was among the best that I've seen. The television channels were limited, but we weren't in the room very long. Their 1 washer & 1 dryer costs $1.00 each, but bring your own detergent and dryer sheets. They don't have vending in the laundry room. Just don't forget to pack your own coffee cups.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; good location”
Reviews.Author: BearAndPenguin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Country Inn and Suites because I had a meeting at UCSD. The location was perfect for access to UCSD which was only about a five minute drive away. The hotel was also within easy driving distance of many restaurants and stores. The area was new and nice and I felt safe. The hotel itself was nice. The staff was friendly and the room was nice and spacious. The bathroom looked slightly dated but overall I was very pleased with the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from downtown, nice place”
Reviews.Author: BackpackGirl
Reviews.Content: This place is a good value, although it's about a 15-minute drive to downtown SD, without traffic. But it's quiet, the staff are very friendly and my room was super clean. But it was a hotel - sterile and lacking personality. Oh well, at least they gave me a free cookie when I checked in!

Reviews.Title: “$97/night nice hotel, little smelly on 7th floor”
Reviews.Author: wrldtravelz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, and they had free cookies in the evening. The check-in went smoothly. We got a weekend nightly rate of only $97 on hotels.com. Stayed on the 7th floor, which was extremely chilly when we got off the elevators. They keep the main area 59 degrees in the halls. The hallway had a funny odor too, not sure if that’s why they try to keep it colder up there. The room was basic & clean. Only place to eat near by is the Chili’s. This hotel is near Quallcom, and other tech companies, so I’m guessing we were in the Tech corridor. Hotel Circle seems to be a better choice if you want more options for meals & entertainment. This hotel overall was a good choice for the price, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: mcpho
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for our San Diego trip, very nice supprise that there were so many things free. Free parking, free internet, free breakfast, what a deal!! I highly recommend this hotel to everyone trying to save a buck in this economy.

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Las_Vegas_voyager
Reviews.Content: I had read good reviews of this place and decided to give it a try when my husband and I went for a weekend to San Diego. We paid a very good price--the hotel discounts for staying more than one night. The hotel was very well kept and inviting, the room was comfortable, beds comfortable. Free wireless in our room was great! The registration staff were courteous and well informed about San Diego. Breakfast was good, with eggs and sausage as well as the usual continental. The second night there were some loud young people banging doors at about 9:00 pm but hotel security quickly came up and quieted them without our having to call. Location wise, it is north of the city itself but highways are easily accessed. It took us about 20 minutes to drive to the Embarcadero, for instance. We definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Country Inn!!! (Long review, sorry!)”
Reviews.Author: angela929
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at the Country Inn was in 2003; My brother had just graduated boot camp and we needed a place to stay near Parris Island. Even though the area wasn't that great, we loved the Country Inn. From the moment we walked in, we felt very welcome. When we needed a place to stay in, or near, San Diego, California, and we discovered there was a Country Inn in the area, we jumped at the chance to book it. Check In was fine, one of our rooms wasn't ready(We had booked two rooms) but it wasn't a big deal. There is a Chili's right across the parking lot so we ate there while we waited. The woman at the front desk that aided us in check-in was very nice and polite. I think her name was Joyce. Our room (617) was nice. We had a king size bed(which was verrryyy comfortable!) with a desk, tv, chair, and a decent size bathroom with ample amenities. We had a view of the office buildings across the street and a side view of the pool which wasn't so bad. There was no funky odor in the room, nor did I find any un-cleanliness. Even though the pool could've been a bit warmer, it was pretty large and was clean. The jacuzzi was good too! I didn't use the exercise room, but it looked fine. Breakfast: Awesome! I'm a big breakfast person, and when it comes to breakfast, I'm very picky. I loved the fact that they put out Dannon Lite & Fit yogurt, along with muffins, pancakes, sausages, eggs, potatoes, juices, coffee, cereal, toast and a waffle maker. It wasn't gourmet, but it was pretty good; and the best part is it's complimentary! I loved the lounge area by the bar. At night, there were always people hanging out, watching tv, or just doing work on their laptops(lots of business folks stay here). Overall, I loved my stay at the Country Inn & Suites. The staff was friendly and helpful, our room was fine, and the hotel itself is well kept(Cleanliness, landscaping, decor, etc.) I definitely recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: sb_tor
Reviews.Content: Difficult to put this hotel down. We paid a low price on priceline. Was given a room on the second floor at the very end. Mostly positives:The room turned out to be very clean and functional. Parking was free, was able to park the car just below our window. Wireless Internet is free and worked fine. There is a complimentary PC downstairs where you can print out anything you want for free. The best part was the complimentary morning breakfast. The selection was huge. Being a business district, the area is nice and clean but nothing nearby. You will need a car, and you will have to drive a bit see the sights. The hotel has a room service menu. There is also a chili's restaurant next door, which is quite good. welcome change from the other 4 star hotels we stayed in during the trip where nothing was complimentary (parking, internet, breakfast, business services like printing). While checking out of this hotel, I almost felt that I paid too less.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: frugalguy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in everything from Four Seasons to motels, but usually prefer Marriot, Hilton or something in that range.Great experience. We paid $119 for a suite, two rooms on Travelocity. Some rooms have a living room and seperate bedroom which they call suites. Check prices because I noticed a wide variation depending on which site you use. A little wear and tear but nothing to complain about. Nice, full breakfast. The location is in a business district. There are a lot of extended stay type of places in the area, Residence Inn, Staybridge Suites and Woddfin. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, unclean room, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: livetortrvl
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel, I was looking forward to my stay, the price was fairly reasonable for a San Diego hotel. The selling points for me were the free parking and the free breakfast. And in that respect, it was fine. However, the room that we were given wasn't cleaned very well. The toilet was filthy, room wasn't cleaned well, mustard packet lying on the floor of the room, there was no soap in the toiled, and there was an opened shampoo bottle on the bathroom floor. We had already hauled our baggage up to the room and were too tired after our long drive, to change rooms. The next morning we discovered that the water was clogging in the tub. Very disappointed with this experience. Thankfully we were staying for one night only. The breakfast was good and plentiful and the parking free, besides that I cant think of anything good about this hotel. Definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: BrownNCA
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel through priceline with fees and taxes for $68 a night - great deal. Rooms were clean, but a little worn. The bathroom had chipped tile and a little mold on the bottom of the shower curtain, but for $68 - can't complain. Great continental breakfast. Would definitely stay again at this price.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lissete
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from the main tourist spots but just about 15 minutes to everything by car. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. They supply two water bottles each day for free, plus coffee & coffee maker in room. They also have free cookies & fruit at the front desk in the afternoon. The free breakfast in the morning is fantastic with a wide variety of food items as described in other posts. The staff is great and always ready to help. One warning though. We arrived late and they only had smoking rooms left. I was told that if I wanted to switch rooms the next day to just let them know. Our room did not really smell like a smoking room, so we decided to not go through the trouble of switching. The problem came when the people moved in to the room next door (7th fl is the smoking floor). Can you say Chimeneys? PLUS they would leave their door open so they could share the cancer with the rest of us! This is not a complaint against the hotel, just the other rude guests.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at the Country Inn & Suites San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sulitster
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain is probably the best kept secret out there. Their service is wonderful. Employees always smiling making you feel at home. I stayed at this hotel with family and all of us enjoyed their fantastic service. The great things about this hotel is the free hot breakfast, free internet access in the rooms and a computer terminal by the elevators for those without laptop, the free parking and the heated outdoor pool that is wonderful after a long day sightseeing or work for those business travellers. The hotel is not really convenient to attractions but if you have a car, then this is a minor inconvenience as downtown is only 14 miles away! The hotel is located off the 805 fwy and is close to many dining and entertainment facilities that can be reached by traveling east about 4 miles on Mira Mesa Blvd. For those who like to get to a mall there is the University Towne Center or UTC that is 4 miles south via the 805 fwy. I defintely recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Country Inn & Suites By Carlson, San Diego North
HotelInfo.Address: 5975 Lusk Blvd, San Diego, CA 92121-2781
